results.title: Sailor beware = Panic in the parlour
results.creator_credit: British Lion Films, Romulus Films, Jack Clayton and Gordon Parry
results.brief_description: From the stage play “Sailor beware” by Philip King and Falkland L. Cary with an introduction by Bill Collins. A humorous tale of domestic conflict between Shirley (Shirley Eaton), her prospective sailor husband-to-be Albert (Ronald Lewis) and Shirley’s overbearing acerbic tongued mother, Emma (Peggy Mount). Cast includes Cyril Smith, Esme Cannon, Gordon jackson, Geoffrey Keen, Joy Webster, Thora Hird.

results.title: Sailing the Greek Isles
results.brief_description: Join Scott Lambert and three other Australians, along with a Greek skipper, for a month among the beautiful Greek Islands. Visit the island of Mykonos with its wonderful Cubist architecture, Rhodes with its castles of the Knights of St John built over 500 years ago, Siftos and Santorini. Legend has it that Santorini, the island on the rim of a giant volcanic crater, and believed to be the home of vampires, is the site of the lost city of Atlantis. Then travel with the group to Turkey, home of the traditional enemies of the Greeks, and visit Effasis the second largest city of the Roman Empire, and then on to see the reputed house of the Virgin Mary.

results.title: Sailing fundamentals. Part 2. Rules and tactics
results.brief_description: Aimed at people who are just starting to sail competitively. Explains the effects of wind shadows and their application to tactics such as lee-bowing. The viewers are then taken around a typical racing course, highlighting the essential rules and tactics with the use of animation and “on board” camera work. Narrated by Clive Hearne.

results.title: Sailing fundamentals. No. 1
results.brief_description: Shows the fundamental principles involved in sailing, including safety measures, the principles of sailing with and into the wind, and explains the functions of various features in a sail boat Cast includes Kate Ronland, Geoff Findlay. Commentator: Bobby Bright.

results.title: Sailing for beginners
results.brief_description: Instruction on dinghy sailing. Describes the main parts of a boat and her rigging, and explains and demonstrates various manoeuvres including going about, beating to windward, running, gybing, sailing triangular and figure of eight courses, and picking up a man overboard. Slow motion and diagrams are used. Filmed at Burnham-on-Crouch with the cooperation of the Royal Corinthian Yacht Club.

results.title: Sailing
results.brief_description: The pleasures of sailing in smaller craft. Different types of sailing dinghies, yachts and canoes in action; the prowess of enthusiasts enjoying this popular sport at many locations in Britain. Closing sequences show HRH the Duke of Edinburgh at the annual Cowes Regatta.

results.title: Sail away
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Bruce Mackay and Roman Kroitor
results.brief_description: A boy named Gus accepts an invitation to spend several days aboard the trimaran Freya. During the cruise he is instructed in the rudiments of sailing and is entrusted with the helm. Ever curious, Gus is taught to identify various forms of marine life. There is a particularly striking sequence of a storm at sea that Gus, the skipper, and the Freya ride out handsomely.
